name: 'Star Trek': Who's Kirk Talking To? Trivia Quiz | Television | 15 Questions

questions.text: The women on your planet are logical. No other planet in the galaxy can make that claim.
Come, come, Mr. (name omitted). Young minds, fresh ideas. Be tolerant!
questions.explanation:
Scott.

	Said in 'Star Trek III: The Search for Spock', after Scotty disparages the new starship Excelsior.

questions.text: I take it the odds are against us and the situation is grim.
questions.explanation:
Picard.

	Said in 'Star Trek: Generations', when Picard is in the Nexus and trying to recruit Kirk into helping him defeat Dr. Soran.

questions.text: 'Let me help.' A hundred years or so from now, I believe, a famous novelist will write a classic using that theme. He'll recommend those three words over 'I love you.'
questions.explanation:
Edith Keeler.

	In TOS ep 'City on the Edge of Forever'.

questions.text: Right, now that we got them just where they want us.
But you'll be trapped as well, forever, at each others' throat, forever through time.
questions.explanation:
Lazarus.

	In the very confusing episode 'The Alternative Factor'.

questions.text: Still, 'old friend!' You've managed to kill everyone else but like a poor marksman, you keep missing the target.
questions.explanation:
Khan Noonien Singh.

	From 'Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan'

questions.text: Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning.
questions.explanation:
Chekov.

	From 'Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country'

questions.text: A no-win situation is a possibility every commander may face. Has that never occurred to you?
questions.explanation:
Saavik.

	From 'Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan'

Maltz.

	From 'Star Trek III: The Search for Spock'. Maltz thought letting Kirk's crew overpower him was dishonorable, and wanted to die. Kirk needed his help to get the Bird of Prey away from Genesis. Promising to kill him seemed the quickest way to get his help.

questions.text: I would not presume to debate you.
We're tired of your phony fireworks!
questions.explanation:
Apollo.

	TOS ep 'Who Mourns for Adonais?'

questions.text: You mean YOU'RE the lunatic who's responsible for almost destroying my ship?!
questions.explanation:
Commodore Matt Decker.

	TOS ep 'The Doomsday Machine'

questions.text: No, I'm from Iowa. I only work in outer space.
questions.explanation:
Dr. Gillian Taylor

	From 'Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home'

Picard.

	From 'Star Trek: Generations'. His dying words, after falling with the wreckage of a bridge, helping Picard defeat Dr. Soran.
